(A) White, yellow, and yellow/red morphs of the wood tiger moth ( Arctia plantaginis) each vary in the extent of their melanisation. (B) The two‐spot ladybird (
Adalia bipunctata ) has numerous morphs including the typical melanic and non‐melanic forms shown here. (C) Morphs of the polytypic poison frog
Ranitomeya imitator . (D) Continuous variation in stripe length and width in the North American striped skunk (
Mephitis mephitis ).
